required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Outcomes From NOCD Treatment of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder Using Exposure and Response Prevention
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Outcomes From NOCD Digital Behavioral Health Treatment of Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder Using Exposure and Response Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: This is a naturalistic, observational study of individuals with obsessive-compulsive disorder who were treated with exposure and response prevention via video teletherapy, augmented with between-session support with text messaging and an online community forum.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from pre-treatment to post-treatment (after 11 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: self-rated psychometric instrument to measure symptom severity of multiple OCD subtypes

secondary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic Interview for Anxiety, Mood, and OCD and Related Neuropsychiatric Disorders (DIAMOND) OCD severity scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-treatment, after 4 weeks, and post-treatment (after 11 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: clinician-rated psychometric instrument to measure overall OCD symptom severity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-treatment, after 4 weeks, and post-treatment (after 11 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: self-rated psychometric instrument to measure depression, anxiety, and stress

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Enjoyment and Satisfaction Questionnaire -- Short Form (QLES-Q)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-treatment, after 4 weeks, and post-treatment (after 11 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: self-rated psychometric instrument to measure quality of life

arm_group.description: adults, adolescents, and children with obsessive-compulsive disorder

intervention.description: Exposures and response prevention therapy (a type of cognitive-behavioral therapy for obsessive-compulsive disorder), delivered in real-time by licensed therapists remotely via video. The treatment was augmented by between-session text messaging and online community support.

study_pop.textblock: This is a naturalistic sample of children, adolescents, and adults with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) who sought treatment for OCD from NOCD, LLC, a digital behavioral health company.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- obsessive-compulsive disorder
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
